quote: Report.
There's an object of some kind   closing in on our position.
On screen.
It appears to be an unmanned probe --   approximately half a meter in   diameter. It has no identifiable   armaments.
We are being hailed...
You are being hailed, sir -- by   name.
Open a channel.
This is Captain Jean-Luc Picard of   the --
I am reading a power surge --
Shields up.
The beam appears to contain   holographic imaging information...
It's trying to project   something...
Isolate the bandwidth and let the   signal through the shields.
Bok...
I trust you remember me, Picard,   because I haven't forgotten you...   or how you murdered my son...
For fifteen years I've thought   about how to avenge his death...   but nothing I could do to you   could equal what you did to me...   until now.
You thought you could hide him   from me, didn't you? But I found   out about him... Jason Vigo is as   good as dead.
I'm going to kill your son,   Picard, just like you killed   mine...
Put a tractor beam on that probe   and determine if it's safe to beam   it aboard. I want to know where   it came from.
Mister Data, see if there's any   mention of a Jason Vigo in   Federation records.       You might start with Miranda Vigo --   she was born on New Gaul about   forty years ago...
Yes, sir.
Contact the Ferengi Government and   find out what you can about Bok.   He was wearing a Daimon's uniform --   if he's regained his rank, I want   to know why.
Come.
The Ferengi Government is debating   an amendment to the Rules of   Acquisition...       -- it might be a while before they   get back to us...
Data found out that the woman you   mentioned does have a son named   Jason.
This is the most recent picture we   could find.
How old is the boy now?
Twenty three.
He and his mother left Earth about   six years ago and settled on Camor   Five. That's all we know, the   planet's records are practically   non-existent.
Picard to Bridge. Set course for   the Camor system, warp five.
Aye, sir.
Wil... I appreciate your not   asking, but you have the right to   know...

There is a possibility that the   boy is my son... I was involved   with his mother for a short time   about twenty four years ago. I   met her through a friend during   shore-leave on Earth. It was all   very romantic...       -- probably because we both knew   I'd be leaving in two weeks... we   kept in touch for a short while,   but we never managed to get   together again...
And she never said anything about   being pregnant... ?

No... either Bok's got it wrong   and I'm not the father, or Miranda   decided she wanted to raise the   child on her own. Quite frankly   it wouldn't surprise me. She was   very independent... very strong-willed...
You'd have to be to get by on   Camor Five.
Whether he's really my son or not,   the fact is he's in danger. Bok   tried to kill me six years ago...   I have no doubt he intends to make   good on his threat against the   boy...
Anything?
There are no Ferengi vessels   within range of our scanners...
Captain, I have been unable to   find any information about Jason   Vigo's current whereabouts...
What about his mother's?
No, sir.
Miranda was trained as a   botanist... she used to talk   about running a farm some day. We   might start with the agricultural   areas.
That would significantly narrow   our search; the only cultivated   land is on the southern continent,   and there are relatively few   people engaged in agricultural   activities.
There can't be too many non-Camorites   among them. Try   scanning for human life-signs.
I am detecting seven humans...   three are female... however they   are all too young to be Miranda   Vigo.
What about males?
One is an infant... another is   elderly... and two are middleaged.
That's seven, you said there were   eight humans.
I am having difficulty getting a   clear reading on the eighth...       -- the individual appears to be   located approximately two   kilometers beneath the planet's   surface.
Male or female?
Male... adult... between twenty   and thirty years old.
No one in their right mind would   go that far underground alone.
Unless he was forced to.
Sir, I am reading seismic   instability in the area. He is in   danger.
Relay his coordinates to the   Transporter Room and have them   beam him aboard.
What the... ?
This is a Federation ship...
That's right. I'm Captain   Picard... Jean-Luc Picard.
I realize I wasn't supposed to be   spelunking that cave, but don't   you have something better to do?
We thought you were in danger.
Oh... well... I wasn't. Maybe you   should just beam me back where I   was?
Are you Jason Vigo?
I... know him. Is he in trouble?
In a manner of speaking...   someone's made a threat against   his life.
Jason... I'm an old friend of your   Mother's. I came here because   you're in danger.
Why would anyone want to kill me?
The person who made the threat is   under the impression that... that   you are my son...
Am I... ?
I don't know...
My mother never told me who my   father was... just that he was in   Starfleet.
Perhaps we should contact her... ?
She... died a few years ago...
I'm sorry...
Jason... I think it's important   that we find out one way or   another. Would you be willing to   permit a genetic test?
If I'm not your son... is this   person still going to want to kill   me?
Once he's made aware of the fact,   I expect he won't...
In that case you won't mind my   saying that I hope you're not my   father...
What were you doing down in that   cave? Are you a seismologist?
No, I just enjoy climbing.
Without an antigrav harness... ?
They get in the way...
So... what do you do?
I'm... between jobs right now.
I see...
Excuse me, gentlemen, but I have   the results if you want to hear   them.
Your genetic code is a cross   between the DNA of your mother,   Miranda Vigo, and your father --   Jean-Luc Picard.
What is all this... ?
Archaeological fragments I've   collected over the years...
This is a Silvan glyph stone...
And this is a Gorlan prayer   stick... it's extremely rare...
Is it valuable... ?
Not really. Only to students of   archaeology like myself. Still,   I had to give up a very old bottle   of Saurian brandy for it.
I'd say you got taken.
Perhaps... but I value it   nonetheless...
On Camor, something has value if   you can eat it or sell it...   everything else is a luxury.
Would you like some tea?
No. Thanks.
Something else?
Tea, Earl Grey, hot.
Well. I'm sure this whole thing   is as much a surprise to you as it   is to me...
I'll be honest with you, Jason.   I was with your mother for only a   short time. I would like to have   known her better... but it didn't   work out that way.
You look a lot like her -- it's   your eyes, I think...
I want to be clear about one thing --   your mother didn't tell me about   you. If she had... I would have   been part of your life.
I guess that's not what she   wanted.
I think I'd like to go back to the   surface.
It would be best if you stayed   aboard the Enterprise... until we   can resolve the situation with   Bok.
What is the situation with Bok,   anyway? Why does he want me dead?
Years ago, I was forced to destroy   a starship that was under his   son's command. Apparently Bok   feels it would be fitting   vengeance to kill my son.
I can't hide forever.
Of course not. We're trying to   locate Bok... I intend to confront   him, settle this matter.
How long will that take?
I assure you -- no one's more   eager to get this behind us than   I am.
Where do I stay?
We'll give you quarters.
Okay. Let's go.
Jason... your being here... I hope   it will give us the chance to get   to know each other.
We managed to shut down the   probe's power systems so we could   beam it aboard, but it's not going   to be easy to figure out where it   came from.
Bok took the precaution of   encrypting the probe's   navigational systems so that we   would be unable to decipher its   flight path.

We ran an analysis of the probe's   hull -- from the energy signatures   and particle deposits we found, it   looks like it travelled through a   Dichromic Nebula, was exposed to   an intensive gravimetric   distortion, and passed within a   light year of a class four pulsar.
Those phenomena are relatively   common -- we would need to   identify at least one of them   specifically in order to postulate   a flight path.
Understood.
Sir, incoming message from Daimon   Birta.
On screen.
Thank you for taking the time to   talk to us, Daimon.
I understand you have a problem.
Yes, it concerns Daimon Bok.
Bok is no Daimon. He was relieved   of command six years ago -- he was   unstable, dangerous. We had to   confine him to Rog Prison.
But he's no longer there?
He was able to buy himself out   about two years ago.
Buy himself out?
He paid his debt to society.
Considering that he is dangerous   and unstable, I trust you've kept   track of him?
He's a private citizen. We take   no responsibility for him.
I see. Do you have any idea of   his present whereabouts?
I understand he was seen in the   Dorias cluster not too long ago...
That cluster consists of over   twenty star systems...
You don't have to thank me,   Captain.
Believe it or not, sir -- that   might've given us the fix we   needed. There's a nebula in the   Dorias cluster that matches the   particle signature we found on the   probe.
There is a class four pulsar three   light years from the nebula -- my   calculations indicate that the   probe was launched in the Xendi   Kabu system.
Plot a course and take us out of   orbit.
Jean-Luc... come in.
I think I need to talk to a   parent.
What's he like?
I'm not sure I can tell you. He's   put up so many barriers... I don't   really know what's underneath.
It would certainly be   understandable if he couldn't   accept you right away...
I can't imagine that he'll ever   accept me. He won't even talk to   me.
Keep in mind... he's had twenty   years to be angry that his father   wasn't there... it'll take time to   get over those feelings -- but I   think it's possible.
Perhaps. But surely it would be   wrong of me to force the issue.
He's made it clear he doesn't want   to pursue a relationship... I   believe I should respect his   feelings.
Of course you want to take your   cues from him... move slowly...   but you might want to keep trying   to get through those barriers.
What I sense about this young   man... is that he's very   independent.       I think it's best if I leave him   alone. Let him come to me if he   wants.
Maybe you're right.       I just think you should consider   one thing.
Are you really thinking about   what's best for Jason... or   easiest for you?
Yeah...
Hello, Jason. I'm Deanna Troi...   the ship's Counselor.
Come in...
Did Captain Picard ask you to come   talk to me?
No... I just came to see how you   were doing. A lot's happened in   the last few hours... I thought   you might want to talk about it.
I'll be all right...       People have wanted to kill me   before...
But you've never met your father   before.
I have to admit I never thought I   would.
It must be somewhat   overwhelming...
I am a little shaky.
Of course. That's only natural.
But you know what? Just talking   to you... I feel better already.
How did you feel about the Captain --   about your father?
He's okay. A little stiff.       Where are you from?
I was born on Betazed...
Do all the women there have eyes   like yours?
Jason... I came here to talk to   you because I'm the ship's   counselor... if you don't want to   talk to me in that way, I think I   should go.
Fine...
You're welcome to make an   appointment to come by my office.
Maybe I'll do just that.
Picard... can you hear me?
I will kill him, Picard. And   there's nothing you can do about   it.
Security to Captain's quarters.
Our shields were up; how could he   have beamed through them?
I don't think he did. Sensor logs   don't show any sign of an   intruder.
Could it have been another   hologram?
I don't think so... something has   to generate a hologram -- we would   have detected it.
Bok once used a mind control   device to make me hallucinate.
That device gave off a very   specific energy signature... I'm   not reading anything like it.
Could he have modified the device   so he could use it without being   detected?
It's possible... I'll recalibrate   the sensors to scan for low   intensity transmissions. And just   to be sure, I'll sweep your   quarters with a resonance scanner.
Good. Keep me posted.
I want you to assign a security   detail to Jason.
What about yourself?
I'm not the target of Bok's   threats. Jason is.
Captain, I have compiled all   available records pertaining to   Jason Vigo's criminal record, and --
His criminal record?
Yes, sir. He has been charged   three times for petty theft, twice   for disorderly conduct, and   several dozen times for   trespassing.
Trespassing?
I believe the charges were related   to his climbing activities in the   caves underneath the planet's   surface.
This is the information you   requested, is it not?
Yes, thank you.
What was your name again?
Lieutenant Rhodes.
Actually, I meant your first name.
Sandra...
Well, Sandra... do you think you   could give me some room?
We're supposed to be keeping an   eye on you.
Don't you think you can keep an   eye on me from over there?
Good morning...
I thought you said your ship was   the safest place I could be.       Why the guards?
Because... Bok appeared in my   quarters last night.
It may not have been Bok -- just   an image of him. We're   investigating.
Look, maybe you should just drop   me off somewhere and let me watch   out for myself.
I don't think that's wise...
I've been doing it since I was   fifteen.
I know you have. But Bok is   extremely dangerous. He has a   starship, technology --
All right, all right. I'll stay   here.
You seem to enjoy rock climbing.   Our Holodeck can create some very   challenging climbs.
Why don't I take you down there   and show you how to use the   programs?
Thanks. But I can figure it out   myself.
Perhaps we could do a climb   together...       I'm probably not as skilled as   you, but I'm not inexperienced.
I kind of prefer to climb alone.
Of course.       There are other sports programs...   fending, for example. Have you   ever fenced?
Hardly.
I think it might appeal to you.   It's very physical... demanding --

Look... I'm sorry...       I appreciate what you're trying to   do. But Captain --       Captain, father, Jean-Luc -- I   don't even know what I'm supposed   to call you... after this thing   with Bok is over, I'm leaving. So   when you think about it, there's   really not much point in our   getting acquainted.
Let me know when you catch him,   all right?
Captain's Log, Stardate 47829.1.   We've been in the Xendi Kabu   system for over three hours, and   still no sign of Bok.
I have completed a subspace   scan... there is an energy   residual that suggests that a   Ferengi vessel, possibly several,   was in this area within the last   eighteen hours.
La Forge to Bridge.
Go ahead.
I've scanned your quarters, sir...   I haven't been able to find   anything that would explain Bok's   appearance.
Understood.
Captain, I am detecting an object   five thousand kilometers off our   starboard bow -- it is another   probe.
Why didn't we detect it before?
It must have been cloaked, sir --   it appeared out of nowhere.
On screen.
Another holographic device?
I do not believe so, sir.
Captain, the probe's systems are   overloading.
Red alert. Shields up!
Damage report.
No damage, sir.
Captain, I do not believe it was   meant as an attack, but rather as   a message.
A message?
In B'Zal, a Ferengi code which   uses an alternating pattern of   light and darkness.
Can you translate it?
I am attempting to do so...       The message appears to read: "My   revenge is at hand."
He's proved he can get to us   whenever he wants. What's he   waiting for?
Tea, earl grey -- hot.
If you want me to stay and talk   you'd better not call for security   this time...
How do you like your boy, Captain?   Is he everything you'd always   hoped for?
It's a risky game you're playing,   coming here. Next time we'll be   ready for you. Why don't we   settle this now?
How do you propose to do that,   Picard? You murdered my son.
It was self-defense. He fired on   my ship.
You were in Ferengi space!
I didn't know that. If he'd told   me I would have withdrawn.       I'm sorry, but there's nothing I   can do to bring him back.
How touching. But your apology is   worthless to me. And I demand   that you repay me for my loss.
You can't put a price on a life.
Oh, but you can, Picard. You can   pay me with your son's life.
No...
I'm afraid you don't have any   choice. I insist on being paid...
That should do it, but let's run   a level-three bio-scan just to be   sure.
Rhodes to Sickbay! Medical   emergency -- deck nine, section   four!
Have you ever had a seizure like   this before?
Not really... sometimes my hands   shake... but it's never been that   bad.
When did it first start to happen?
A few months ago... do you have   any idea what's wrong with me?
You have a condition called   Forrester-Trent syndrome. It's a   degenerative neurological disorder --   very rare.
What do you mean degenerative?

If it goes untreated, it can lead   to paralysis... even death. I'm   starting you on a neuro-stabilization   regimen. If we're   lucky, we should be able to halt   the degeneration, maybe even   reverse it.
The disease is hereditary.       I know your father doesn't have   it... was your mother prone to   seizures?
Not that I know of.
There have been a few reported   cases where the disease was   instigated by random mutation...       I'll run a micro-cellular scan to   see if that's what happened.
In the meantime, I want you to   take it easy, get some rest.
Is he going to be all right... ?
I wish I could say for certain.   There's no way to know how he'll   respond to the treatment.
Is there any... facility we can   take him to -- where they might   have special expertise?
I'm afraid there isn't. But I'll   do everything I can.
I know you will... I'm sorry.   It's just hard for me to accept   that there's nothing I can do...
I understand...

I've been thinking about what you   said the other day. You were   right, you know. I convinced   myself Jason didn't want me to   reach out to him...       Because I don't have the faintest   idea how to do it.
I don't think anyone is born   knowing how to be a parent. You   kind of figure it out as you go.
But nothing I try seems to work.
I think anyone who's had a child   can relate to that.       If there's one quality parenthood   tends to require -- it's patience.

I'm just not sure that's going to   be enough in his case.       I found out he has a criminal   record. Nothing terribly serious --   petty theft, that sort of thing --   but... he's a grown man. Is it   too late for him to turn around?
That's really up to him.
Maybe. But you can't blame   yourself for not having been   there. All you can do is be there   for him now.
And be patient.
And be patient.
I think we've found something...
Bok was in direct contact with   this chair for an extended   period... it is showing a   distinctive subspace signature as   a result.
We think he's using some sort   of... subspace transporter to   beam aboard the Enterprise.
My understanding is that such   devices were impractical.
The Federation abandoned its   research in the field because the   technology was found to be   unreliable... as well as extremely   energy intensive.
In order to transport matter   through subspace, you have to put   it into a state of quantum flux --   it's very unstable.
The quantum effect would explain   why our sensors did not detect   Bok's presence.
It would also explain why he was   able to penetrate our shields.
What range would this kind of   transporter have?
In theory it could operate over   several light years.
That means the probe that exploded   could have been beamed into   position from some point outside   sensor range.
If Bok uses his transporter again,   we may be able to trace the   subspace signature and locate his   ship.
Is there any way to keep him from   beaming aboard the Enterprise   again?
I don't think there is...
If he has the ability to beam   aboard, he might be able to beam   someone away.
It is a possibility.
I'm concerned that he's going to   try to take Daniel -- is there any   way we can protect him?
We could keep a signal lock on him   at all times... if Bok tried to   beam him away, we might be able to   keep him from getting a pattern   lock.
In order to do so, we would have   to tie the ship's subspace field   coils into the transporter system.
Make it so.
Open.
Would you mind waiting outside?
Not bad...
I like climbing. There's   something about... literally   having your fate in your own   hands.
I know.
I came to tell you that we may   have found a way to locate Bok's   ship... this might be over soon.
You came all the way up here just   to tell me that?
I thought it might make you feel   better.
Thanks.       That was nice of you.
Jason... after your mother and I   parted... I lost track of her   completely.       I'd like to know more about what   happened to her... if you don't   mind telling me.
Like what?
Well... why did you go to Camor?   It seems an unlikely place for a   woman and a child...
You know what she was like...
See a stray cat -- take it in.   See someone cold -- give them your   coat.
That was Miranda, all right.
She heard about the children on   Camor who'd been orphaned during   the Cardassian war.
I see...
I was only ten when we went there.   I remember her telling me about   all the boys and girls who didn't   have anybody to take care of   them...

So she found this big house...   practically falling apart... and   started rounding up children.       Eventually, there were over forty   of them...       She called it a school. She got   up before dawn and she went to bed   after midnight and in between she   never stopped working. She taught   everyone to read... she grew   vegetables in hardpan to feed   us... and she made sure we knew   how to sing.       That was important in a place like   Camor...

Then one day... two men attacked   her... on the street in broad   daylight... for the food she was   carrying...       If she'd just given it to them,   they probably wouldn't have hurt   her. But she knew we needed the   food...       So they killed her.
I'm sorry...
Don't be sorry for me. My mother   made sure we were all tough enough   to make it.
Jason... isn't there some way I   can be a father to you?

My father and I were estranged...   he thought I should stay home and   tend the vineyards and I wanted to   join Starfleet. He died before we   could come to terms about it...   and I've regretted that all my   life.       I don't want the same thing to   happen to us.
Don't you understand? I'm not   anyone you'd want for a son.
Trust me -- if you knew anything   about me, you wouldn't be trying   so hard.
That's not so...
No? Well let me spell it out for   you. I've been in trouble since   I was a teenager... I steal, I   lie, I use people. I'm a   criminal. That's what your son   is.
I know.
I'm aware of your trouble with the   Camor authorities.
You are?
It doesn't change anything.   You're still my son. And, like it   or not, I'm your father. I don't   know what that means, but I know   it means something. That we're...   connected...
Yes...
At the very least...       -- I know you'll never look at   your hairline the same way again.
Come on -- let's get to the top of   this thing...
You wanted to see me?
It's about Jason...
I finished the micro-cellular scan   I was running... there's something   you need to know...
Sir... sensors detect a subspace   carrier wave heading toward the   ship...       -- its signature is consistent   with Bok's transporter.
Can you tell what part of the ship   it's headed toward?
Not yet, Commander.
See if you can track the signature   and locate Bok's ship.       Geordi, are you ready down there?
I've got a signal lock on Jason.
Riker to Captain --
Picard, here.
Bok is trying to use his   transporter.
The transporter beam is focusing   on deck nine, section four.
Jason's quarters...
I'm on it, Commander.
What's wrong?
Security to Bridge -- Bok is   beaming Jason off the ship!
Initiating transport, now --
I'm losing his signal...
Bok's re-establishing his lock...
Have you been able to locate Bok's   ship?
No, sir. The subspace signature   left by his transporter is   decaying more rapidly than   predicted -- it may not be   possible to trace it.
Sir, another probe has   materialized five hundred   kilometers to starboard...       -- it is sending a transmission.
On screen.
This is a very special day,   Picard. Fifteen years ago you   took my son away from me... today,   I will take yours away from you.   It will be... our anniversary.
I wanted you to see him one last   time... so you could cherish his   memory forever...
I have traced the transporter beam   Bok used to send the probe -- His   ship is holding position   approximately three hundred   billion kilometers from here...
Plot a course -- maximum warp.
Even at warp nine we won't get   there for almost twenty minutes...
The modifications you made to our   Transporter... is there any way   you could try a subspace transport   from here and get me aboard Bok's   ship?
It may be possible, but it would   not be advisable.
You're with me.
You know... if you're trying to   make Captain Picard suffer,   killing me won't do it.
We didn't exactly hit it off. I   think I'm something of an   embarrassment to him.
You're lying. Picard would never   reject his own son.
I mean it -- he cares more about   his crew than he does about me.
You are a clever young man. But   I do not believe that Picard will   be unaffected by your death.
Daimon... if you kill him, the   human will not pay the ransom.
He will... Picard won't know the   boy is dead until it's too late...
Yes, Daimon...
There... I've aligned the field   coils...
The phase dampers are in synch...   standing by to modulate the   transport pattern...
Sir, we might be able to get you   over there, but I don't see how   we're going to get you back.
We'll deal with that when the time   comes.
The transport is going to take   longer than normal... we're going   to have to shunt your pattern   through the subspace field   coils...
Understood...
Initiating transport sequence...   now...
Look... maybe we could make a   deal.
What kind of deal?

Tell my father you killed me...   Put a phaser burn on my shirt and   send it to him. He'll think I'm   dead. That's what's important,   isn't it?       I have friends on Camor Five   who'll make it worth your while.
I understand your desire to live.   But I want Picard to see your body --   so there will be no doubt.
Lower your weapons or Bok is   dead...
Lower yours... or your son dies.
You know as well as I do, Bok...   he's not my son.
I know what you did... Miranda   Vigo is Jason's mother... but, I   am not his father... it only   appeared as if I were because you   resequenced his DNA...
But your technique was flawed...   Jason began to suffer from a   neurological disorder... when my   ship's Doctor investigated its   cause, she discovered what you'd   done...
Now he'll never pay the ransom...
There was never going to be any   ransom. All Bok has ever cared   about was vengeance.
Is this true, Daimon?
He is no longer a Daimon -- he was   stripped of command.
They had no right to do that to   me.
He lied to you so you'd help him   carry out his plan.
The Enterprise is closing in on   your position... if you let us   both go now, you won't be   attacked.
Your crew won't attack -- not   while you're on board.
They'll cripple your vessel and   keep you here until the Ferengi   authorities arrive.
You'll have a great deal of   explaining to do... your only hope   is to turn Bok over to them and   tell them that he deceived you.
There is no profit in this for   us...
Captain's Log, Stardate 47831.8.   At Jason's request, the Enterprise   has returned to Camor Five.
Doctor Crusher said I'm responding   well to the treatment... she   thinks the damage is going to be   completely reversed...
I'm glad to hear it...
Are you sure you wouldn't like to   stay aboard the Enterprise for a   few more days?
I can't... I have a life on   Camor...       -- it's a bit of a mess, but I   want to go back and try to   straighten things out...
I understand...
Well...
Maybe... next time you come back   this way, you can look me up...
I will...
I slipped a little something into   your bag while you were packing...
I know you'd prefer a bottle of   Saurian brandy... but this is all   I could come up with.
I... I can't accept this...
I want you to have it...
Energize...
